item.title: Videos From Minnesota Show How Aggressive ICE Has Gotten During Arrests and Encounters With Protesters
item.description: For weeks, residents have documented the impact of President Trump’s mass deportation campaign and captured many violent confrontations on camera.
item.dc:creator: Elena Shao, Arijeta Lajka, Helmuth Rosales and Raj Saha

item.title: John Brodie, a Star Quarterback for the 49ers, Dies at 90
item.description: He endured years of frustration before emerging as the N.F.L.’s most valuable player.
item.dc:creator: William Yardley and Frank Litsky

media:content.media:credit: Digital First Media Group/Oakland Tribune, via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: John Brodie in 1970.

item.title: La Casa Blanca publica una foto alterada de una manifestante detenida en Minnesota
item.description: The New York Times pasó la imagen por un sistema de detección de IA y concluyó que presentaba signos de manipulación.
item.dc:creator: Tiffany Hsu, Alan Feuer and Stuart A. Thompson

media:content.media:description: Nekima Levy Armstrong luego de hablar en un mitin contra el ICE en St. Paul, Minnesota, el lunes. El Departamento de Justicia dijo el jueves por la mañana que la había detenido y que estaba acusada de ayudar a interrumpir un servicio religioso en St. Paul.

item.title: An Unlikely Source of Crypto Innovation: Afghanistan
item.description: The repressive Taliban government is suspicious of the internet. But a start-up in the country is building blockchain-based tools to transform humanitarian aid.
item.dc:creator: Aryn Baker and Emile Ducke
item.category: United Nations High Commission for Refugees

media:content.media:credit: Emile Ducke for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Local beneficiaries wait in line to receive their aid payments as part of a Mercy Corps pilot project using HesabPay, a blockchain-based payment system developed in Afghanistan, in the town of Halfaya, Syria.

item.title: What Europe Learned From the Greenland Crisis
item.description: Territorial integrity is a core tenet of Europe that is at risk from Russian and American imperialism. Brussels has fought back.
item.dc:creator: Steven Erlanger

media:content.media:credit: Juliette Pavy for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A protest against President Trump’s attempt to take over Greenland, in Nuuk, last week.

item.title: Corrections: Jan. 24, 2026
item.description: Corrections that appeared in print on Saturday, Jan. 24, 2026.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Big Perks Get Mobile Gamers to Keep Spending
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, January 24, 2025.

item.title: Child Support?
item.description: Adrian Johnson and Ryan McCarty team up on a killer themeless puzzle.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Lovinger

media:content.media:description: Two skeletons appear to go in for a kiss during a Day of the Dead parade in Mexico City in 2016.

item.title: Federal Judge Extends Deportation Protections for Burmese Migrants
item.description: The ruling represents another setback in the Trump administration’s mass deportation campaign.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:description: A federal judge wrote an opinion hat there was significant evidence that Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem’s decision to end Temporary Protected Status for Burmese immigrants was arbitrary and capricious.

item.title: Pepper-Sprayed While Pinned Down: A Searing Scene Provokes Outrage
item.description: Images of a man getting pepper-sprayed at close range while being held down by Border Patrol agents fueled more tension in Minneapolis.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño

media:content.media:description: Border Patrol agents deployed pepper spray while holding down a man on Wednesday in Minneapolis.

item.title: Thousands of Anti-ICE Protesters Brave Frigid Temperatures in Minneapolis
item.description: Thousands of protesters shut down parts of Minneapolis and St. Paul on Friday as hundreds of businesses closed their doors, and workers and students stayed home to demand an end to the sweeping immigration crackdown that has roiled the Twin Cities for weeks.
item.dc:creator: Jackeline Luna

media:content.media:description: Thousands of protesters shut down parts of Minneapolis and St. Paul on Friday as hundreds of businesses closed their doors.

item.title: Renée Fleming Won’t Perform at Kennedy Center Concerts
item.description: The soprano, who previously resigned as an artistic adviser, was scheduled to sing with the National Symphony Orchestra in May.
item.dc:creator: Jason M. Bailey
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

media:content.media:description: Renée Fleming was honored by the Kennedy Center in 2023.

item.title: Thousands March Through Manhattan to Protest ICE Crackdowns Across U.S.
item.description: The detention this week of a 5-year-old boy in Minnesota animated protesters in New York City, who faced freezing temperatures.
item.dc:creator: Christopher Maag, Wesley Parnell and Olivia Bensimon

media:content.media:credit: Shuran Huang for The New York Times

item.title: El FBI captura a un ex atleta olímpico canadiense acusado de asesinato y narcotráfico
item.description: Ryan Wedding, de 44 años, quien compitió en snowboard en los Juegos Olímpicos de Invierno de 2002, ha sido acusado de asesinato y contrabando de cocaína en Estados Unidos.
item.dc:creator: Vjosa Isai

media:content.media:description: Ryan Wedding, a former Olympic snowboarder, has been charged with smuggling cocaine into the United States and with murder.

item.title: The January 2026 U.S. Winter Storm, in Maps and Charts
item.description: See where dangerous conditions, including snow, ice and below-freezing temperatures, are expected.
item.dc:creator: Judson Jones, Daniel Wood, William B. Davis, Bea Malsky, Aatish Bhatia and Josh Katz

item.title: Judge Dismisses Case Against Real Estate Developer Charged With Bribery
item.description: This is one of five indictments charging Eric Ulrich, the former New York City buildings commissioner under Eric Adams, with taking bribes totaling more than $150,000.
item.dc:creator: Hurubie Meko

media:content.media:credit: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Mark Caller, left, and Eric Ulrich at their arraignment in State Supreme Court in Manhattan on corruption-related charges in 2023.

item.title: U.S. Says First Boat Strike Since Maduro’s Capture Killed 2 in Eastern Pacific
item.description: The U.S. Southern Command said it had asked the Coast Guard to search for one survivor.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Ahn
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )

media:content.media:credit: U.S. Southern Command, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: An image from a video released by the U.S. Southern Command showing a vessel accused of trafficking drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean on Friday.

item.title: Setting Foot on the Melting Thwaites Glacier
item.description: Bad weather ​delayed expedition scientists’​ ​efforts to set up camp on Thwaites Glacier ​in Antarctica ​and take measurements ​to determine how quickly it is melting. After the skies cleared, our journalists​, Raymond Zhong and Chang W. Lee​, took us along for their first steps on Thwaites.
item.dc:creator: Raymond Zhong, Chang W. Lee, Christina Thornell and Jon Miller

item.title: ICE Agent Charged With Misdemeanor Following Scuffle With an Activist
item.description: The police in Brookfield, Ill., filed a battery charge against a federal agent, who was off duty when he scuffled with an immigrant rights activist.
item.dc:creator: Danny Hakim

media:content.media:credit: Carlos Javier Ortiz for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The Broadview Processing Center has been the center of a number of anti-ICE protests in recent weeks.

item.title: Tremors in Japan Prompt Treasury to Weigh Currency Intervention
item.description: New York Fed inquiries about the cost of exchanging yen for dollars signaled to traders on Friday that the U.S. government might make a large purchase of the Japanese currency.
item.dc:creator: Joe Rennison, Alan Rappeport and Colby Smith
item.category: Federal Reserve Bank of New York

media:content.media:description: The possibility of a large-scale purchase of yen at some point by the U.S. Treasury lifted the currency’s value 1.6 percent against the dollar on Friday.

item.title: What I Love About This Year’s Oscars
item.description: The Oscar nominations are out, and the best picture category includes “Sinners,” “One Battle After Another,” “The Secret Agent” and “Marty Supreme.” These four movies tie history to our present moment, says Wesley Morris, and could make this year’s Academy Awards show one to watch.

item.title: Venezuela acepta recibir más deportados de EE. UU.
item.description: El gobierno interino de Venezuela ha dado otra señal de sus esfuerzos de apaciguar al gobierno de Trump y está recibiendo más ciudadanos deportados. Esta semana han llegado tres vuelos.
item.dc:creator: Annie Correal, Luis Ferré-Sadurní and Hamed Aleaziz

media:content.media:credit: Alejandro Cegarra para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un vuelo de deportación procedente de Estados Unidos que llega al Aeropuerto Internacional de Maiquetía Simón Bolívar el jueves.

item.title: Cacio e Pepe Ramen
item.description: Ramen noodles bring a bouncy twist to this classic Roman pasta dish. You’ll want the black pepper to be very coarse so that it can infuse the butter and achieve that fruity heat without burning.

media:content.media:credit: David Malosh for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Simon Andrews.

item.title: Sheet-Pan Pierogies With Brussels Sprouts and Kimchi
item.description: Roasting pierogies yields a crisp, golden skin with a soft, pillowy interior but, if you don’t have pierogies, you could use gnocchi in their place.

media:content.media:credit: Linda Xiao for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Monica Pierini.

item.title: HUD Demands Public Housing Officials Check for Undocumented Immigrants
item.description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development said it would punish public housing authorities that did not adequately verify tenants’ immigration status within 30 days.
item.dc:creator: Chris Cameron

media:content.media:description: Public housing on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. A spokesman for the city’s Housing Authority said in a statement that the federal government already required documentation of all tenants’ citizenship status.

item.title: Buffalo Sauce
item.description: Nutty browned butter adds a wonderful underlying note to this otherwise straightforward Buffalo sauce.

media:content.media:credit: Ryan Liebe for The New York Times. Food Stylist: Victoria Granof.

item.title: S.E.C. Drops Case Against Cryptocurrency Firm Founded by Winklevoss Twins
item.description: The agency says that victims of an investment offering involving Gemini Trust got their money back, though after a regulatory action brought by the New York attorney general.
item.dc:creator: Ben Protess and Sharon LaFraniere

media:content.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss at a digital assets summit at the White House last March.

item.title: Manhattan Doorman Killed as N.Y.P.D. Sergeant Crashes Into Him Head-On
item.description: The sergeant, Tiffany Howell, 47, was driving the wrong way on the Taconic State Parkway in New York when she crashed into Manuel Boitel, 61, the state police said.
item.dc:creator: Maria Cramer

item.title: John H. Beyer, 92, Dies; Architect Championed Historic Preservation
item.description: The last surviving founder of Beyer Blinder Belle, he helped safeguard New York City’s past even as developers raced to push the city into the future.
item.dc:creator: Clay Risen

item.title: Vance Announces Expansion of ‘Mexico City Rule’ to Cover D.E.I. and ‘Radical’ Gender Policies
item.description: The change, which could affect more than $30 billion in foreign assistance, is the Trump administration’s latest move against what the president calls “woke ideology.”
item.dc:creator: Michael Crowley

media:content.media:description: Vice President JD Vance at the annual March for Life in Washington on Friday.

item.title: Russia Jails U.S. Navy Veteran for Five Years
item.description: Charles Wayne Zimmerman, who had been fulfilling his dream to sail around the world, appears to be the latest American imprisoned as part of Russia’s “hostage diplomacy.”
item.dc:creator: Neil MacFarquhar

media:content.media:description: Steve Witkoff, the presidential envoy who has been negotiating with the Kremlin on a peace deal in the Ukraine war, was believed to have raised the issue of incarcerated Americans during his repeated visits to Moscow.

item.title: America Prepares for a Major Storm
item.description: Also, demonstrators flooded Minneapolis streets to protest ICE. Here’s the latest at the end of Friday.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cullen

media:content.media:credit: Christian Murdock/The Gazette, via Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Colorado Springs, Colo., on Friday.

item.title: How the National Park Service Is Deleting American History
item.description: Philadelphia sued the Trump administration after it directed the Park Service to rip out a memorial to slavery. Elsewhere, materials about climate change and labor history were being removed.
item.dc:creator: Maxine Joselow and Jennifer Schuessler

media:content.media:credit: Rachel Wisniewski for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A visitor to the removed signs at the National Historical Park in Philadelphia on Friday.

item.title: Joint Chiefs Chairman Issues Rare Invitation to Foreign Military Heads
item.description: Top military leaders from 34 countries plan to discuss improving efforts in the Western Hemisphere to fight drug trafficking and transnational criminal organizations.
item.dc:creator: Eric Schmitt
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Gen. Dan Caine’s meeting comes at a fraught time for Washington’s relations with its immediate neighbors as well as allies in Europe.

item.title: Are Republicans Growing a Little Uneasy About the ICE Raids?
item.description: Polls, careful remarks from JD Vance and chats with voters all point to some wariness.
item.dc:creator: Katie Glueck

media:content.media:description: Federal immigration agents in Minneapolis.

item.title: Snow and Ice Are Coming. Where Is the Salt?
item.description: Heavy snow, ice and bitter cold are threatening much of the country, but some places are short on a key resource: road salt.
item.dc:creator: Aimee Ortiz

media:content.media:credit: Sara Hylton for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A salt shed on Spring Street in Manhattan on Friday. Some smaller cities and towns were reporting a shortage of road salt as they prepared for the first major winter storm of the season.

item.title: National Park Service Removes Slavery Exhibit in Philadelphia
item.description: Following a directive from President Trump, the National Park Service removed a Philadelphia exhibit memorializing nine people enslaved by George Washington. The administration ordered the removal of materials that promote “corrosive ideology” in favor of those highlighting American “greatness.”
item.dc:creator: Axel Boada and Daniel Fetherston

media:content.media:description: An outdoor exhibit on slavery at Independence National Historical Park in Philadelphia in October. The National Park Service has taken down the exhibit.

item.title: FBI Agent Resigns After Trying to Investigate ICE Officer in Renee Good Shooting
item.description: The resignation of the agent, Tracee Mergen, was only the latest shock wave to have emerged from the Justice Department’s handling of the shooting of Renee Good.
item.dc:creator: Alan Feuer and Glenn Thrush

media:content.media:description: Police and federal agents at the scene where an Immigration and Customs Enforcement agent fatally shot Renee Good in Minneapolis this month.

item.title: Is This Who Trump Meant by the ‘Worst of the Worst’?
item.description: The columnist Jamelle Bouie argues that the Trump administration’s immigration policy has more in common with ethnic cleansing than actual immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Jamelle Bouie and Ingrid Holmquist
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

item.title: Former Olympian Arrested on Drug Trafficking and Murder Charges
item.description: F.B.I. agents arrested Ryan Wedding, a former Olympic snowboarder, in Mexico on Thursday. Mr. Wedding is accused of smuggling cocaine into the United States and hiring a hitman to kill an F.B.I informant. The ex-snowboarder is expected to appear in court on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Jorge Mitssunaga

media:content.media:description: Ryan Wedding, a former Olympic snowboarder, has been charged with smuggling cocaine into the United States and with murder.

item.title: Extreme Cold Sweeps Canada, With Manitoba and Saskatchewan Among the Worst Hit
item.description: The lowest temperatures are expected in southern Saskatchewan and southern Manitoba.
item.dc:creator: Amy Graff

item.title: What Stephen Miller Is Signaling to ICE Officers
item.description: Stephen Miller’s public endorsement of aggressive ICE tactics marks a new chapter in American immigration enforcement, says Caitlin Dickerson, a journalist, on “The Ezra Klein Show.”
item.dc:creator: ‘The Ezra Klein Show’

item.title: Trump’s $170 Billion Surveillance Machine
item.description: Caitlin Dickerson, a journalist, explores the unrestrained power and perils of Trump’s immigration enforcement on “The Ezra Klein Show.”
item.dc:creator: ‘The Ezra Klein Show’

item.title: ICE, School District Give Conflicting Accounts of Child’s Detainment
item.description: Liam Conejo Ramos, 5, was detained with his father by immigration authorities on Tuesday. The school district and the federal government have given conflicting accounts of what happened during the arrest.
item.dc:creator: McKinnon de Kuyper

media:content.media:description: Immigration agents have been circling schools in Columbia Heights, Minn., and following school buses, according to the school superintendent, Zena Stenvik.

item.title: Pedro Sanchez, Who Helped Feed the Developing World, Dies at 85
item.description: A soil scientist, he partnered with the United Nations and other organizations to bring productive agricultural practices to uncooperative terrain.
item.dc:creator: Trip Gabriel

item.title: El colapso de Trump que está en camino
item.description: Estamos ante el declive del orden internacional de posguerra, el de la tranquilidad en EE. UU. debido al ICE, el del orden democrático y el de la mente de Trump.
item.dc:creator: David Brooks

media:content.media:credit: Mark Peterson para The New York Times

item.title: How to Prepare Your Home for a Winter Storm
item.description: Follow these steps to stay warm and safe.
item.dc:creator: Dorie Chevlen

media:content.media:description: Some buildings may lose power during the winter storm this week.

item.title: Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen of Denmark Visits Greenland
item.description: The trip by Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen to the Danish territory came amid pressure from President Trump and appeared to have been meant as reassurance to Greenlanders.
item.dc:creator: Maya Tekeli

media:content.media:description: Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen of Denmark, in the tan coat; the mayor of Nuuk, Greenland, Avaaraq Olsenand; and Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen of Greenland set off on a highly choreographed walk through the city on Friday.

item.title: Winter Storm Forecast: Where the Ice Could Hit Worst
item.description: Even a little ice can be far more dangerous than snow in some places.
item.dc:creator: Judson Jones
